job description:
As a data scientist, you will work with our analysts and engineers to apply machine learning techniques to enrich our first-party data offerings. You will work within your team to identify, prototype, and deliver production-ready ML models and algorithms. It will be your task to innovate and push the boundaries of the influencer-marketing space.

Here's what you'll be doing:
  • Working with large sets of social-data, spanning multiple social-networks and third-party vendors (Demographic Pro, IBM Watson, AWS Rekognition, etc).
  • Building and deploying ML models / algorithms at scale.


Here's what we'd like to see:
  • MS+ in Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Physics or Computer Science (or technical degree with commensurate industry experience).
  • 3+ years of experience working as a full-time data scientist.
  • Excellent understanding of statistics, machine learning algorithms, processes, tools and platforms.
  • Proficiencies: Python, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, tensorflow, SQL, etc.
  • Ability to write technical papers, as well as convey complex / abstract concepts to non-experts (Abstracts, Executive Summaries, etc).
  • Innovative, creative, hungry, willing to learn and explore.


Bonus points if:
  • Have experience in the social-media landscape.
  • Have a portfolio of written / published papers within the space.
  • Have experience in Graph Mining and Link Prediction.


About Influential

Influential is an A.I. influencer technology and developer partner of IBM Watson. Influential’s patent-pending app is on the hip pocket of more than 10,000 of the most highly engaged influencers on Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter, and YouTube, reaching over 5 billion users. Brands and agencies are able to make a digital media buy on social via Influential’s in-demo impression guarantee, which mirrors traditional and digital media spends. Influential conducts all campaigns through a brand-safe gateway and provides robust reporting via 3rd party analytics partners. Influential and IBM Watson have co-created technologies that allow brands and agencies to identify psychographic data on influencers, as well as three first-to-market A.I. products. Influential runs campaigns for Fortune 100 companies including Coca-Cola Company, Nestlé, General Mills, Kia Motors, Fox TV, Sony Pictures and more. Influential has offices in Beverly Hills, New York City, and Las Vegas.
